radiographic_examinations.findings: Imaged lung bases are clear without pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver is normal in attenuation without focal lesion or biliary ductal dilatation. The gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable. The kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically. The appendix is seen and normal. Extensive pericolonic fat stranding with an inflamed diverticulum identified in the ascending colon. Focus of air adjacent to diverticulum may reflect microperforation. No focal fluid collection; no free air or fluid in the abdomen. The uterus and adnexa are unremarkable; possible trace free pelvic fluid. No lytic or sclerotic bony lesion.
